definition: to drag (sb) along (to a place)/to yank
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: On the way home, ping is a group of bad guy robbed, and is strong to pull out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 在回家的途中，萍被一羣壞人搶劫，並被強拉下車。

sentences.english: There is a long history of companies pushing banks to stand behind their deals.
sentences.chinese: 公司強拉銀行做後盾的歷史由來已久。
